meanings.definition: Glozing (verb): to disguise or conceal the truth
meanings.sent1: She was glozing her real intentions with a smile.
meanings.sent2: The spy was glozing his identity to gather information.
meanings.sent3: The magician's glozing of the disappearing act amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: His glozing of the situation was like a veil over the truth.
meanings.sent5: The politician's glozing of the facts left everyone confused.

meanings.definition: Glozing (adjective): characterized by deceit or deception
meanings.sent1: The glozing smile on his face made her suspicious.
meanings.sent2: The glozing words of the con artist fooled many people.
meanings.sent3: The glozing behavior of the fox tricked the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her glozing look hinted at her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The glozing tone of his voice raised doubts in her mind.

meanings.definition: Glozing (noun): the act of misleading or deceiving
meanings.sent1: The glozing of the facts led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: His glozing was eventually uncovered by the investigators.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's glozing of the audience's reactions was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The glozing in the play added an element of mystery.
meanings.sent5: The glozing in her story made it more intriguing.
